g.text: Continuous archiving can be used to create a cluster configuration
with one or more servers ready to take over operations if the server fails.
the servers are only loosely coupled.
Recovery performance is sufficiently good that the standby
will typically be only moments away from full availability once
Restoring a server from an archived base backup and rollforward will take considerably
longer, so that technique only offers a solution for disaster recovery, not high availability.
can be used to tune the replication lag
Streaming granular WAL records (not entire segments)
allows a much smaller window of data loss
Log shipping replication is asynchronous by default
